<Link id="l00101" /><CodeLine lineNumber="101"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// This is a variant of from generic&#95;parser&#95;base::printOptionInfo.  Sadly,</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00102" /><CodeLine lineNumber="102"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// it&#39;s not easy to make it more usable.  We could get it to print these as</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00103" /><CodeLine lineNumber="103"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// options if we were a cl::opt and registered them, but lists don&#39;t have</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00104" /><CodeLine lineNumber="104"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// options, nor does the parser for std::string.  The other mechanisms for</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00105" /><CodeLine lineNumber="105"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// options are global and would pollute the global namespace with our</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00106" /><CodeLine lineNumber="106"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// counters.  Rather than go that route, we have just overridden the</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00107" /><CodeLine lineNumber="107"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// printing, which only a few things call anyway.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00108" /><CodeLine lineNumber="108"><span class="doxyHighlight">    <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/#a2d79a00fa7c56f57b87f2fe2a3f118c7">outs</a>() &lt;&lt; </span><span class="doxyHighlightStringLiteral">&quot;  -&quot;</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> &lt;&lt; ArgStr;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00109" /><CodeLine lineNumber="109"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// All of the other options in CommandLine.cpp use ArgStr.size() + 6 for</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00110" /><CodeLine lineNumber="110"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// width, so we do the same.</span></CodeLine>
